title: Incorrect parsing of values in scientific notation in tensor constructors
body_html:
Code example

>>> torch.tensor(1.001e10)  # incorrect
tensor(10010000384.)
>>> torch.tensor(1e10)  # correct
tensor(10000000000.)

System Info

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): python setup.py build develop
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2
  • PyTorch version: master
  • Python version: 3.6.5

body:
## Code example
```
>>> torch.tensor(1.001e10)  # incorrect
tensor(10010000384.)
>>> torch.tensor(1e10)  # correct
tensor(10000000000.)
```

## System Info

- PyTorch or Caffe2: PyTorch
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
- Build command you used (if compiling from source): python setup.py build develop
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2
- PyTorch version: master
- Python version: 3.6.5
